intro: Lavatera punctata, commonly known as the spotted lavatera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, oval-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively drought-tolerant once established. Lavatera punctata is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
